p: Using the consensus for the five ecological niche modelling algorithms, both climate change scenarios indicated different patterns of range stability, contraction or expansion for L. intermedia (Fig. 6) and L. neivai (Fig. 7). For L. intermedia the predictions were for substantial contraction in the southern part of its range, where uncertainty mapping lent confidence to the predictions; and any expansion was limited to small areas in the northern part of its range, where uncertainty mapping suggested moderate-high confidence in the predictions. In contrast, for L. neivai the predictions were for a large range shift southwards, and uncertainty mapping lent confidence to the predictions.
